This movie was released in 1965 and is based on the novel of the same name by Boris Pasternak.

The movie tells the story of two main characters: a doctor named Dr. Zhivago and his wife Yelena. The story revolves around their relationship, love, heartbreaks, and ultimately their deaths.

The movie "Doctor Zhivago" is considered to be one of the greatest movies ever made. It has won numerous awards including three Academy Awards for Best Director (Stanley Kubrick), Best Picture, and Best Adapted Screenplay (Kubrick).

conversation.text: Based on the preferences mentioned, I would recommend the movie 'Casablanca' (1942). This classic film stars Humphrey Bogart as Rick Blaine, an American expatriate who runs a nightclub in Casablanca, Morocco, during World War II. The film's plot revolves around Rick's attempts to save his former lover, Ingrid Bergman, from the clutches of her despotic husband, Max von Banzel, also known as "The Man with No Name." 'Casablanca' is widely regarded as one of the greatest movies ever made and has received numerous accolades, including Academy Awards for Best Picture (1954)), Best Director (1953)), Best Actor (1952)), Best Adapted Screenplay (1952)), Best Cinematography (1952)), Best Film Editing (1952)), and the European Film Award for Best European Feature Film (1986)).
